1.segment: Patients with silicosis caused by occupational exposure to engineered stone ( ES ) present a rapid progression from simple silicosis ( SS ) to progressive massive fibrosis ( PMF ) .

2.segment: Patient classification follows international rules based on radiology and high-resolution computed tomography ( HRCT ) ,

4.segment: have explored biomarkers from routine clinical tests that can be used as predictors of disease status .

5.segment: Our objective was thus to investigate circulating biomarker levels and systemic inflammatory indices in ES silicosis patients whose exposure to ES dust ended several years ago .

6.segment: Ninety-one adult men , ex-workers in the manufacturing of ES ,

7.segment: 53 diagnosed with SS and 38 with PMF ,

8.segment: and 22 healthy male volunteers ( HC ) as controls not exposed to ES dust , were recruited .

9.segment: The following circulating levels of biomarkers like lactate dehydrogenase ( LDH ) ,

10.segment: angiotensin-converting-enzyme ( ACE ) , protein C reactive ( PCR ) ,

11.segment: rheumatoid factor , alkaline phosphatase and fibrinogen were obtained from clinical reports after being measured from blood samples .

12.segment: As biochemical markers , only LDH ( HC = 262 ± 48.1 ; SS = 315.4 ± 65.4 ; PMF = 337.6 ± 79.3 U/L ) ,

13.segment: ACE ( HC = 43.1 ± 18.4 ; SS = 78.2 ± 27.2 ; PMF = 86.1 ± 23.7 U/L ) and fibrinogen ( HC = 182.3 ± 49.1 ; SS = 212.2 ± 43.5 ; PMF = 256 ± 77.3 U/L ) levels showed a significant sequential increase ,

14.segment: not been observed for the rest of biomarkers ,

15.segment: in the HC → SS → PMF direction .

16.segment: Moreover , several systemic inflammation indices neutrophil-to-lymphocyte ratio ( NLR ) ,

21.segment: aggregate index of systemic inflammation ( AISI ) derived from whole blood cell counts showed significant differences between the HC , SS and PMF groups .

22.segment: All these biomarkers were analyzed using receiver operating characteristic ( ROC ) curves ,

23.segment: and the results provided moderately high sensitivity and specificity for discriminating between ES silicosis patient groups and healthy controls .

24.segment: Our study reveals that some inflammatory biomarkers ,

25.segment: easily available from routine blood analysis ,

26.segment: are present in ES silicosis patients even several years after cessation of exposure to ES silica dust and they could help to know the progression of the disease .
